c74object.name: mvc.state
c74object.digest: Declare a state and its attributes
c74object.description: mvc.state declares a state in the MVC namespace - it is very similar to the mvc.parameter object, except that its value is not stored in presets. It is typically used for internal values that need to be queried or set but not stored. For instance, you may want that for the playhead position of a sample player.
c74object.discussion:
An mvc.state object enable to define states in a model (defined by an mvc.model) to which we'll be able to send data and consequently tweak a process. We can also fetch its value, e.g. to display it in a GUI. Last, unlike mvc.parameter, mvc.states can not be saved in presets. ... to be discussed if this should just be a flavour of mvc.parameter.
mvc.parameter helps defining a model in the MVC model used in the MVC package.

inlet.name: Value input
inlet.digest: Value to set the state to.
inlet.description: Value to set the state to.

outlet.name: value output
outlet.digest: Value the state was set to.
outlet.description: Value the state was set to.

outlet.name: address outlet
outlet.description: Since mvc.state can declare multiple addresses thanks to the braces notation, this outlet provide the specific address for which we are receiving a value on the first outlet.

outlet.name: dump outlet
outlet.description: Messages and information in reply to various messages

objarg.name: parent-UID
objarg.digest: Parent node's UID to which this mvc.state is attached.
objarg.description:
The parent node can either be :
an mvc.device : in this case, one should provide the device name (which is its own UID).
an mvc.model : in this case, one should provide the model's UID (see mvc.model reference).

objarg.name: state-name
objarg.description: The state name should be a symbol (that is, it can contain spaces, as long as it is surrounded by quotes). Note that the use of slashes (like "cutoff/frequency") in the name is prohibited. Best to keep it short.

method.name: anything (on the left inlet)
method.description: The values will be sent to all addresses covered by the mvc.state namespace.

method.name: setvalue (on the left inlet)
method.digest: Set the value of a specific address in the mvc.state namespace.
method.description: The values will be sent to the addresses of the mvc.state at the specified index (following the setvalue method in MC components).

method.name: name (on the right inlet)
method.description: Multiple state addresses can be set with the brace expansion notation.

method.name: parent (on the right inlet)
method.digest: UNSUPPORTED. Set the model to which this state is attached.

method.name: get (on the right inlet)
method.description: Since a single mvc.state instance can stand for multiple addresses, the get message will generate a series of addresses and values output on the first and second outlet of the mvc.state object respectively.

method.name: dump (on the right inlet) --- NOT YET IMPLEMENTED!
method.digest: Dump all attributes settings to rightmost outlet
method.description: The message dump outputs all attribute settings to rightmost outlet

method.name: reset (on the right inlet) --- NOT YET IMPLEMENTED!
method.description: The message reset sent to the leftmost inlet reset the current value to the value defined by the default attribute

attribute.name: default
attribute.description: The default attribute sets the value to output at the leftmost outlet on model initialization. The default value can be overridden by the default model preset

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: The description attribute allows to agive a textual description for this node. This helps documenting the state and can be retrieved by GUI elements (e.g. mvc.GUI.number).

attribute.name: max
attribute.description: The max attribute defines the maximum value of expected range of possible values. Depending on the clip attribute, this might be a recommended or mandatory range.

attribute.name: min
attribute.description: The min attribute defines the minimum value of expected range of possible values. Depending on the clip attribute, this might be a recommended or mandatory range.

attribute.name: type
attribute.digest: Value type (integer, decimal, string, bool, list)
attribute.description:
The type attribute defines the type of the value. Possible types are:
decimal (default): a floating point value.
integer : an integer value.
string : a string value (aka "symbol" in Max).
bool : boolean value. Implicitely clips value to 0/1
list : a list of elements including numbers and symbols
dict : a dictionary

attribute.name: unit
attribute.description: The unit attribute defines the unit used by this state. It can be retrieved and displayed by GUI (and could possibly allow for dynamic unit conversion in the future).

attribute.name: range
attribute.description: The range attribute defines the expected range of possible values. Depending on the clip attribute, this might be a recommended or mandatory range.
